cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 200 miles SSE of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coast, then curving north across Louisiana and Arkansas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cameron, LA â€“ on the TX/LA border south of Lake Charles

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge watch from Mouth of the Mississippi River to Ocean Springs MS, including Lake Pontchartrain/Maurepas/Borgne
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning east of Intracoastal City LA to the Mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast through south-central and southeast Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39-55 mph) with higher gusts possible Wednesday night through Thursday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water levels 4-7 ft above ground possible from Morgan City to the Mouth of the Mississippi River, potentially penetrating inland along the river and adjacent lakes
weather_observation.rainfall: 2-4 inches with localized higher totals could cause flash flooding and river rises
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in rainbands; dangerous rip currents and rough surf ahead of the storm
